title: Johnny Galecki reunites with Big Bang Theory pals for brand new sitcom
text:
Johnny Galecki will focus on the world of eSports for his new series (Picture: Getty)

Johnny Galecki is reuniting with The Big Bang Theory writer Anthony Del Broccolo to delve into a new sitcom based on the world of eSports.

The show, titled The Squad, has been given a script order at NBC, home of fan favourite shows which have included The Good Place, Brooklyn 99 and Parks and Recreation in the past.

Johnny will act as executive producer on the show, with Anthony writing the series which focuses on a new group of friends who bond over their mutual love of the video game based sporting competitions.

It seems that after 12 years The Big Bang Theory squad is making sure they’re keeping themselves busy, with Johnny in particular making a reappearance on Roseanne spin-off The Connors, and preparing to become a father for the first time.

This will be his first executive producer and development role since the short-lived series Living Biblically last year, which showed a man living life according to the Bible after the death of a friend.

His other pals have been launching a series of new projects too – with Jim Parsons, who played Sheldon, announcing a new docuseries that explores hidden icons of LGBT history last week and producing Netflix mini-series sitcom, Special.

The Big Bang Theory have busy since the show ended (Picture: Getty/NBC)

He’s also in the middle of a US version of the sitcom Miranda with former co-star Mayim Bialik, who starred as his Big Bang Theory wife Amy. The project has been renamed Carla.

Then of course there’s the Big Bang Theory spin-off Young Sheldon, for which he executive produces as provides voiceover.

More: The Big Bang Theory The Big Bang Theory plot hole means we have no idea how Leonard and Sheldon actually met Kaley Cuoco is feeling pretty great about the end of The Big Bang Theory now Kaley Cuoco sends late present to The Big Bang Theory cast but it's worth the wait

On top of it all, Jim has signed up to star in an upcoming Ryan Murphy Netflix series, joining an all-star cast for Hollywood.

The Squad is yet to be given a release date in the US or the UK. The Big Bang Theory is available to stream on Netflix in the UK.
